intro: Acomastylis elata var. typica, commonly known as the slender acomastylis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while the flowers are small and clustered in heads. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
